channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: High Rates Have Been Good for One Corner of the Mortgage Industry. Now What?
item.description: Mortgage servicers have benefited in multiple ways from higher rates and a slow housing market.

item.title: Merck beats earnings expectations, raises sales outlook on strong demand for top drugs like Keytruda
item.description: The drugmaker raised its full-year sales forecast to $63.4 billion to $64.4 billion on increased demand for key products, particularly oncology treatments.

item.title: Wednesday's Other Central Bank Meeting Might Be the One to Watch
item.description: The Bank of Japan will announce an interest-rate decision on the same day as the Fed, with big consequences.

item.title: Johnnie Walker-maker Diageo plunges 10% on full-year sales decline, but Guinness a bright spot
item.description: Shares of spirits giant Diageo tumbled on Tuesday morning, after the Johnnie Walker-maker posted its first sales decline since the start of the pandemic.

item.title: Standard Chartered Profit Falls, Announces $1.5 Billion Share Buyback
item.description: The bank said underlying profit before tax climbed 14% to $1.83 billion.

item.title: Oil major BP raises dividend as second-quarter profit beats expectations
item.description: British oil giant BP on Tuesday reported stronger-than-expected net profit for the second quarter following a warning over lower refining margins.

item.title: Investors Embrace Bond Funds Before Rates Start to Fall
item.description: Fixed-income exchange-traded funds collected more money than ever during the year’s first half.

item.title: McDonald's is falling short, needs to win over low-income consumers, key exec tells operators in memo
item.description: McDonald's U.S. president said the company fell short in key areas during its second quarter and needs to refocus on value.

item.title: It's a Cruel Summer for Big Tech Stocks
item.description: The Magnificent Seven confront their next test when Microsoft, Meta, Amazon.com and Apple report their results this week.

item.title: Heineken shares fall 10% after first-half profit miss
item.description: Operting profit showed organic growth of 12.5%, below a company-compiled consensus forecast of 13.2%.
